alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 08 at 11:19AM EST until further notice by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Columbia affecting Lexington and Richland Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Congaree River at Columbia. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding occurs in flood prone areas near and downstream from Columbia. Flooding also occurs on parts of the Cayce and West Columbia river walk. At 13.0 feet, Flooding occurs in flood prone areas near and downstream from Columbia. Flooding also occurs over much of the Cayce and West Columbia river walk. At 14.0 feet, Roads in low lying areas and swampland downstream from Columbia become flooded. Most of the Cayce and West Columbia river walk is flooded. At 16.0 feet, Old State Road, SC 66, below Cayce becomes flooded. At 19.0 feet, Extensive swampland and large areas of farmland and pasture land downstream from Columbia become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will begin rising above action stage by Wednesday afternoon, and rise to 17.4 feet by Friday morning. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1130 AM EST.
